Does this mean that life begins before one is born?
 
 
 REDWOOD CITY, Calif. — Scott Peterson has been found guilty of first-degree murder in the death of his wife Laci, and second-degree murder in the death of their unborn son, Conner.  
 Peterson could face the death penalty or life without parole.

post_info.post_title: Murder of a fetus brings guilty verdict.

 An important note: Laci Peterson was eight months  pregnant when she was murdered.

 Do some checking to see under what conditions legal abortion is permissable in the USA.

Do some checking to see under what conditions legal abortion is permissable in the USA.

 
 Here is the only thing I could find (in 5 minutes):
 http://www.guttmacher.org/in-the-know/restrictions.html
 
What is Roe v. Wade?
 
 * Roe v. Wade is the 1973 U.S. Supreme Court decision that recognized that a woman has a constitutional right to decide whether to continue her pregnancy. The Court also ruled, however, that after fetal viability, states may restrict or ban abortions entirely, except when necessary to protect the woman's life or health.

 
How is abortion legally restricted in the United States?
 
 * States can restrict abortion or prohibit it entirely after viability (that is, the point at which the fetus is able to live outside the woman's body, with or without artificial aid)-except when necessary to protect the woman's life or health-and the vast majority of states have done so. The most common restrictions on early abortion are parental involvement requirements, state-directed counseling and waiting periods, and limitations on public funding. [80]

 
 I guess Scott Peterson's child was considered a "viable fetus."
